alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 3:09PM CDT until June 09 at 11:35AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Caddo, Blaine, Custer and Canadian Counties.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC011-015-017-039-090815- /O.NEW.KOUN.FL.W.0011.220608T2009Z-220609T1635Z/ /BRIO2.1.ER.220608T1911Z.000000T0000Z.220609T1034Z.NO/ 309 PM CDT Wed Jun 8 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Flood plain fields at higher elevations away from the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County may see flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 15.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
